headline: Excellent support team
reviewBody:
I recently studied my Level 3 HRP with DPG and I cannot fault my experience. 
The support team are always ready to help and nothing is to much trouble, thankyou to the lovely ladies I spoke to on different occasions to swap workshops :)

headline: Flexible But Low Quality
reviewBody:
Pros:
I chose DPG because of the self-led learning, there are no deadlines and you can work as quickly or slowly as you want. 

Cons:
Course material is outdated and presented through a learning platform that is not modern or engaging. E-Lessons provided often do not seem relevant to the assignment for the module. 

Takes three weeks for assignments to be marked! I had a couple of occasions where this was longer than the three week period as well, which is so disheartening when your assignment is referred and you have to wait another 3+ weeks. 

Lack of support from facilitators and tutors, answers on webinars always very vague and I only found out at the end I was meant to have a personal tutor! They never reached out to check in. Without a Facebook study group I stumbled across I would have no idea how to complete the course! 

Wouldn't study again with DPG.

headline: Excellent experience with CIPD level 5 HRM qual
reviewBody: I throughly enjoyed my CIPD level 5 studies with DPG. Although I hadn’t studied for 20 years and never online, I didn’t feel unsupported at any point because the online facilitators and DPG community were always on hand to offer advice and explain the assignments in more detail if I was unsure of anything. Now I’m finished,  I miss the course!

headline: Great speedy response and information…
reviewBody: Great speedy response and information provided.

headline: bad admin and poor course material lets it down.
reviewBody:
Where do I begin! I have just completed my Level 7 with DPG (3 year prior I had completed my L5 with them also so I have had a the full experience). this feedback relates to my L7:
General admin of the course extremely poor 
1) the log in details I got from day one didn't work and it took weeks to get this sorted, in fact it was me who suggested could it be because I had done L5 and there might be a duplication.
2) I had to follow up numerous times to get the details of course dates and locations
3) once I was even sent to the wrong location (and I later heard it wasn't just me who had this experience).
4) having picked my modules at the start of the course I was then told at the start of  my y2 to rebook, when I did I was told the London dates were now full. Only after kicking up a fuss (because 1 why ask us at the start and then do nothing and if you don't tell us we need to do this why would we!) did they book me onto London dates.
5) on almost all of the occasions prior to attending the training days I had to chase up for the online modules to be added to my profile.
6) all of the course material was extremely out of date, it hadn't been updated for over 6 years and very often in the classes we were told to ignore a lot of the content.
7) this is a personal view - I felt the exam prep workdays were not very helpful. They were light and lacked support and preparation with how to answer the questions. Often we were told to read the past papers but they did not give you actual examples of what a good answer looked like or was structured. 
8) When I finally came to get my qualification my maiden name was given to CIPD, this caused a 3 month delay in getting my certificate and again something i had to sort out - this was even after I had told DPG 3 times prior that my name had changed.

On a positive side, I found the tutors in general to be very good. 

Given how the course switched to be online due to covid I was disappointed that DPG offer no refund or reduction for what had been charged as an in person course.

headline: Clear direction and support 24/7
reviewBody: I wouldn't be more satisfied from all the proffesors and admin staff. I have completed my CIPD Level 5 Diploma beasuse of their clear direction supoort. Thank you for everything DPG. I am looking forward to reach Level 7 in few years.

headline: Lucy Simpson was very supportive…
reviewBody: Lucy Simpson was very supportive throughout my course, if i had any concerns or questions she answered them promptly and accordingly. If you are someone who is considering distance learning i would recommend this course. Thank you for all your help.

headline: Great support
reviewBody: I was unsure if I would complete the course when I started as English is not my language. However, the online facilitator has always been there to support me and I found online community useful. Thanks to all support, I could complete all my programme 100% online!

headline: I have completed my CIPD level 5 with…
reviewBody: I have completed my CIPD level 5 with DPG and now started my level 7 with them as well, as DPG prices are so competitive than the rest of the providers and the support is unparalleled. Roderick Briggs dealt with my enquiry very promptly and helped me by answering all my queries very efficiently. I would highly recommended DPG.

headline: DPG made my dream come true!!
reviewBody:
DPG made my dream come true. I worked in the hospitality sector for almost 20 years and was sadly made redundant last year due to the pandemic. The majority of my experience was in Finance. 
The chairman of the Hotel asked me to move from my Financial Controller role to HR as a Group HR Manager–Support Services as part of a restructuring of the HR team. This is where my love for HR started. The pandemic gave me an opportunity to study towards my CIPD. I chose to study with DPG  and the guidance I received was brilliant - access to their platforms, community and tutors. I finished my course in 9 months with a break of one month. I have also managed to find a role in HR. This was all due to the immense support i received from DPG..

headline: Poor quality learning
reviewBody: Online learning is poor quality. The Advanced qualifications consist of 4 short e-learning modules with poor quality references and citations (even though it’s stressed to do further reading). Activities consist of a handful of downloadable documents branded with ICS Learning, templates quoted in e-learning are not available on the platform and no further reading resources are sign posted, other than list of books (which you have to buy yourself). Facilitators prompt discussions in group forums but no one actually responds - this indicates how engaging it actually is. One webinar per module is offered, which effectively is used as Q&A on how to pass an assignment rather than gaining knowledge and understanding about the subject. I raised my concerns and I effectively was told to leave the programme by the customer experience team. Given the hype around new CIPD qualification, my recommendation is go somewhere else as DPG has clearly struggled to keep up with the change.

headline: LIARS
reviewBody: LIARS! Do NOT believe when they tell you you can change your mind in the first 14 days and get your money back!!! There is no trial period, it's all LIES, then they will tell you that since you accessed the course you can't change your mind!

headline: I waited 4 months to review DPG so that…
reviewBody:
I waited 4 months to review DPG so that it can be more insightful. I have passed half of my assessments and I am so pleased to have chosen DPG over other mainstream competitors for so many reasons. 

With DPG, I was able to pay over several months and start at my convenience without any pressure to finish at a certain time, you are given 2 years if need be to complete and it's up to you to choose your pace depending on what life throws at you.

Once you start you have several tools in place to help you along the way: 
-The e-lessons (where all the content is thought, quizzed and referenced)
- The briefs are then provided (where you are explained thoroughly what is expected)
- The community pages (where you can find guidance to obstacles)
- The Webinars (where you can ask your questions live, which are recorded for other students to watch later)
- You then submit your assessment online and get marked within 3 weeks which I think is completely reasonable.
With even more supporting tools in place, it's really easy to navigate through the assessments and get unstuck, manage your workload and plan your own study. 

I couldn't recommend DPG enough, the assessors have all the patience in the world and always there to help.
If you're comparing all the providers (like I did quite thoroughly) then do consider DPG as they really are specialists in the field, care about what they do and not just after your money.

headline: MESSED UP MY COURSE
reviewBody:
I purchased the level 5 diploma and after I completed the course, I was issued with the certificate. They initially insisted I only paid for the certificate and I had to provide proof of purchase and previous emails. I then had to go back and do the remaining modules that make up the diploma and they had agreed to Mark my work as a priority to make up for their administrative error. Every time I submitted work, I had to remind that I was promised to be marked as a priority and had to provide proof of this. Not once was it marked as a priority despite them saying it would be. 
They messed up and went back on their word. 
The system also isn’t the best and I had issues from time to time with it and had to call up and request support with errors.

headline: Flexible course, very long waiting time on marking.
reviewBody: I really like the flexibility of the program, doing this on maternity means I have to work around little one and this course allows me to do that.  The downside is the length of time getting back assignments - a minimum of 3 weeks, by which time I'm well onto another section so if there were any referrals, I'd have to go back and start again with it.  My first module was referred as I hadn't added in references, so I had to wait 3 weeks for the referral mark, then another 3 weeks for the new feedback (which I passed) during which time I've submitted another 3 modules.  Just feel this needs to be quicker when we're working so hard to get the work in.  Online facilitators get back to you really quickly but it is a shame you don't get one tutor that you can build a rapport with, it's pot luck who gets back to you, would have liked a bit of continuity - all have been helpful though.

headline: I am very happy with the services and…
reviewBody:
I am very happy with the services and support provided by DPG when enrolling.
First, if it weren't for the super special price and great payment conditions, I don't know when it would be possible to take this course. I was researching with a DPG competitor (ICS Learn) and, when I asked if he could get a better discount, the attendant said to look for another company because they would never give a better discount than that but it was the best thing that happened to me. Unlike the competitor ICS, the service at DPG was first class. Super fast, efficient return, Roderick was super patient and clarified all my doubts and always presented solutions to all obstacles. I am very excited and looking forwards to start my CIPD qualification.
In these times of uncertainty, this course was all I needed to try to get a job in such a competitive market during the pandemic. Thanks to DPG for the for the attitude of offering 50% off in your qualification!

headline: Good First Impression

I have been informed I can contact my facilitator by phone or email and the DPG community is available to post to other members of the team. So, so far a great first impression.

headline: I decided to do the CIPD Level 5 in HR
reviewBody:
I decided to do the CIPD Level 5 in HR. So far I'm in the second module, it has been great. They provide a lot of support and based on what I see, they try to always apply the theory to practical examples. So the idea is when you finish this course, you actually know how to apply all these to your organisation and it's not just theory learnt. 
In their course, they have some sort of simulation where you can put the theory into HR practice. This was one of the convincing points that I really liked compared to others. 
They are always providing webinars where you can ask questions and the facilitators answer. They are very helpful. I must say that I'm really happy with DPG. 
The only criticism that I have is that assignments can take up to 3 weeks to be corrected. I don't expect assignments to be corrected in a day like ICS is doing, but I'd say a week would be ideal, the reason behind is because once you start with your other module and you are very into the reading material and writing, it's hard to go back to the previous assessment if you have to re-do it. I understand if there is a lot of work but I'd suggest as a business that they can find approaches on how to improve correction time. 
At the moment, based of what I've seen ICS corrects within a day or two and Avado same week, so it'd be really good if DPG could nearly match their competitors. 

Having said that, I'd definitely recommend DPG. Facilitators are really good, professionals and always trying to give practical examples so that you understand.

headline: Disappointed
reviewBody: I booked my course with DPG as I heard they were the best, although be careful when they say they are fully flexible.... I enquired about workshop and exam days prior to booking the course and paying my huge costs as I knew that I would be getting married. The sales lady confirmed that the dates were not on the day’s I needed for Honeymoon which was perfect, a few weeks later I receive an email to say that they have changed the workshop order and dates and after checking it now coincides with my wedding so I cannot attend. I panicked and advised the gentleman who had sent the email as the course hadn’t yet started, he advised... don’t worry about it there will be plenty of other dates for you to attend just let us know on your induction. So I did this, however I am now advised that I will need to attend the workshop in London.. which will cost me an extra £150-£200 for travel and a hotel stay as the workshop is for 2 days... Not a great start to my journey with DPG.

headline: Good course
reviewBody:
I submitted my last assignment as well as my reflective blog last week so I have now completed the CIPD Level 5 Diploma in HR Management. 

I thoroughly enjoyed the course but struggled a bit with vague answers from the facilitators sometimes when stuck with a question on assignments and also feedback from the assessors when referring on an assignment.  I appreciate they can't just 'give us the answer' but at times I felt like I was back in the 80s on the TV show 321 trying to work out the cryptic clues but ending up with Dusty Bin!!!

As it is 100% online, you can sometimes feel as if you are on your own.  However, I think I may have been in one of the first groups to start the 100% online course as there did not appear to be that many students ahead of us so therefore even less people to ask advice from.  Now, there are lots of people studying online and they help each other which is great to see.  I also tried to help people who were struggling with units I had already passed.

Initially, the briefing videos for each unit were not fantastic, especially for CHR.  Several people did post saying they were struggling and the facilitators redid the videos last July which was great.  Unfortunately, this was after I had struggled through so I found this unit particularly difficult.

One other thing that a lot of us agreed on was the length of time it took to mark assignments.  The assessors have up to 3 weeks but with other providers, they are marked within 5 days.  Perhaps this could be looked at going forward?

I would like to study one unit online at Level 7 (Employment Law).  Unfortunately, DPG do not offer this online but other providers do (cost £923).  I would be looking to start this later in the year so if DPG were to offer this online, I would be very interested.  I will keep my eye out for any changes :)

headline: Great experience.
reviewBody: Good level of information before enrolling on the course. Quick responses to email queries . Once enrolled all materials and courses loaded as required with a detailed induction of training and support available throughout the course. Additional benefit of achieving the ILM level 5 leadership and management alongside the CIPD level 5 HR Management is a great bonus to studying one course. Great experience to date.

headline: The worst experience EVER
reviewBody:
The worst experience in a course, read before enrol, please!!
First of all they never answer my emails ASAP, it could take up to three days once you are in, but when you are asking for a course the answer takes up to 5 min. I told the advisor to start this course and my contract says 14 days for a cancellation, I try to study with their website and is like the worst website in the world, you can’t even open the files with safari so I don’t know why they offer an iPad if you can’t use it. And of course is not a gift you need to pay for it. Once I decided to cancel my course in 8 days after the call, (wasn’t a real enrol) they told me by email (late answer) that I need to pay all the course cos I already log in on my student page, how can try the course if I’m not in their website? And I don’t have any miscall or email with an answer or how to fix this.. is the worst service in the whole England.

The community is a great way to network with people and reach out to those who can support you with any questions you may have. The webinars are very informative and really helped me with my assignments and implement changes in my role. Overall DPG have massively supported my professional development and I would recommend them as a provider if you’re thinking of taking the step!

headline: Absolutely no regrets!
reviewBody: I am from Trinidad, West Indies and I have only now started the CIPD Online Level 5 HRM. This is my first ever online programme. I was scared at first because all my life I have only known face-to-face and classroom sessions. To be quiet honest the DPG plc has provided alot of information at our fingertips. I love that the site is user friendly, its on-the-go capability that can be used anywhere at anytime, consistency, accessibility and navigation to webinars and different links etc. is on par. Looking forward to a great year and more with the DPG plc family and by extension the world of people I will be interacting with through DPG.

So far unfortunately I am not impressed.

headline: Great experience
reviewBody:
Big thank you to DPG consultants, Sharon, Dayana, Rebecca. I had a complex payment case and DPG supported. I then needed to adjust the study schedule for health reasons and received excellent support again. Adjusting schedule added great experience seeing other facilitators in action and also work with different groups. I am not encouraging that, no.  But this allows me to say facilitators are great! 
I would probably if I could take a quarter of a star for materials. DPG please check the links to additional material. Some of them refer to articles that are no longer available.

headline: CIPD LEVEL 3 for L&D
reviewBody:
CIPD LEVEL 3 for L&D

I haven't studied for a qualification is a very long time.  DPG has a blended learning experience which includes e-learning, webinars and workshops. 

I preferred the workshops over the e-learning because that's how I like to learn.  I think there were too many E-Lessons.

The course tutor was very friendly and always was in touch when I needed to talk to her.  

Overall a positive experience.

headline: Excellent customer service with timeous…
reviewBody:
Excellent customer service with timeous feedback and information!
Personalised online experience.

headline: Very straightforward and helpful.
reviewBody: Very straightforward and helpful.

headline: Part of the funding for my CIPD was…
reviewBody: Part of the funding for my CIPD was from the army’s Elcas system. Due to this there were issues in my application. However Sean from DPG bent over backwards and provided constant updates on the process.

headline: CIPD
reviewBody: Very Informative and responsive.

headline: The team at DPG are fantastic Sean and…
reviewBody: The team at DPG are fantastic Sean and Claire were both really helpful and having done my first ever webinar yesterday it really is better than I ever expected an online course to be. Looking forward to the next few months ahead .

headline: I m just about to start level 5 with…
reviewBody: I m just about to start level 5 with DPG. The materials look really impressive. Have already been given lots of support and information. I recommend and give the highest rate.

headline: CIPD Level 5 - HRM - 100% Online
reviewBody: I studied a CIPD Level 5 qualification in HRM. Great learning experience and interaction, I took the 100% online option and the e-lessons are very easy to follow with great add-ons if you want to learn more or go deeper into a subject. The assignment brief webinars give a very useful overview of the areas you need to demonstrate an understanding of to meet the criteria to pass. There is one contact throughout the course (your personal facilitator) and they are joined along the way by subject matter specialists so that you gain as much knowledge as possible throughout the course. Highly recommended.

headline: Excellent support from friendly and…
reviewBody: Excellent support from friendly and competent staff.

headline: I have just completed my Level 5 CIPD…
reviewBody: I have just completed my Level 5 CIPD 100% Online course and found it to be interesting and informative.

headline: Fantastic informative and prompt service
reviewBody: Fantastic informative and prompt service

headline: Good salesmen
reviewBody: The guys are obviously salesmen, and although they don’t come across as knowledgeable as other providers they were very fast to answer all queries.  They were the first to look at finance options for me and calm any worries I had about the online delivery system.  Not sure what the course is like yet so will review again when finished.

headline: Excellent experience
reviewBody:
Diane Graham was professional, informative and friendly. 

Diane asked about my education, background and what I do on a daily basis to ensure I was choosing the right course. She called and emailed when she said she would and I received all the information I needed to apply in a timely manner. Diane was easy to talk to and friendly. 

DPG was recommended to me by a colleague and now I would recommend DPG to anyone who is considering studying with them.

headline: Great service
reviewBody: Great service, easy to use and great advisors, what more could anyone ask for

headline: Helpful and informative
reviewBody: Rodin was quick to respond to any questions I had and was helpful and informative.  The whole process was complete quicker than I expected. No hard sell and helps taylor the right course for you

headline: Fantastic service
reviewBody: Fantastic service

reviewBody: Roddy was absolutely great, very efficienct and speedy responses.

headline: Caitlin in particular was incredibly…
reviewBody: Caitlin in particular was incredibly helpful.

headline: I've just signed up
reviewBody: I've just signed up to one of the courses. The service so far has been fast, friendly and very helpful! Really excited to get started. Thanks DPG

headline: Fantastic Programme!
reviewBody: Really supportive and fun interactive programme (CIPD Level 5 Diploma in HRM). Great support from facilitators and assessors. Can't fault it!

headline: I haven't had much from DPG since I…
reviewBody: I haven't had much from DPG since I joined the programme despite issues with accessing my learner pathways. Still awaiting someone to contact me on this.

headline: Very smooth transaction.
reviewBody: Very smooth transaction.

headline: DPG plc gave me the best opportunity to learn
reviewBody:
DPG plc gave me the best opportunity to learn and experience the Level 5 Diploma in Human Resource Management. Their tutors are insightful, relevant and all have current experience in HR.

Their blended course of workshops and online learning is fantastic and will suit anyone working full time.

headline: The content was engaging and I was able to work at my own pace
reviewBody: I chose DPG above the other providers because they offered the HRM Level 5 Diploma 100% online and I was impressed with being able to look around their virtual business environment before I committed.  I was a little anxious about studying again having not done so since leaving school many years ago,  working full time and raising a young family!  I found the e-lessons and course resources easily accessible, clear and engaging. The live online question and answers sessions were very helpful and were all recorded so I could catch up if I missed any and the facilitators were easy to contact. I was able to work at my own pace which was particularly helpful as I sadly lost my father at the start of my course and completed my studies within 13 months. I would highly recommend DPG.

headline: Very disappointing service received
reviewBody: I had provisionally book a space for the March intake group, I explained to the sales consultant and one of his colleagues that my boss was back from holiday on Monday and that I would have all my paperwork sent over as soon as I had finalised all with my boss. I expressed that my boss have already given the go ahead before going on holiday and that this was a matter of formality before sensing in my forms. I had spoken to my consultant a number of times in the day to keep in touch regarding the progress. I sent off my form later that afternoon and was told all was secured in terms of my place on the programme. I then received an email, no phone call, informing me my application was rejected as the programme was now fully booked and there was no space for me attend the programme. At no point in time did any of the two consults advise that I could loose my place if the paper work was not handed in. Whats the point of a provisional booking if it actually can't book anything? I feel let down and disappointed, that the consultant did not have the courtesy to call me regarding this and felt that an email was good enough! This is a programme that cost well over £4000 and that's how you get treated for the money you are paying. Secondly I had rearranged our own internal training calendar for the year as well as other events in our business to cater for my attendance which I will have to change again based on the July programme workshop dates. Lastly on a personal note, I know have to wait until July to attend the programme which is four months away and now means I only get to qualify at the end of January next year as apposed to October this year. I would still like to attend the March group and feel that I should not have to suffer due to the poor service of the consultants representing your company.
